alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 6:08PM MDT until June 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 608 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have ended over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar, but runoff will continue into the evening hours. Multiple rounds of thunderstorms today have brought between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain across the northern and eastern portions of the burn scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Remember, debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding and excessive runoff in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Sandoval County Additional locations affected include This includes Canon del Norte, Spruce Canyon and Pines Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall and resultant excessive runoff will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
